page.title: 04WAYSIDE CROSSES
page.content: There are three crosses and they are all made out of granite rock and they are to tell the pilgrims where to stop and rest so that they could see the church. The crosses don't have any words on them. The cross at the top of {Winson Hill}is two and a half metres tall and sixteen centimetres wide. Winson Cross is near Winson Farm. It is on the main road. Just down the side road near Stuart's house there is a well. It used to be a spring. This was where{Saint Urith}fell. They cut her down with scythes. There could have been more crosses in the area on each of the roads into Chittlehampton at the places where pilgrims could see the Tower of Chittlehampton Church for the first time. The three crosses that are left are in the churchyard, at Winson and at Eastacott (grid ref.02620123)
